title: Taming Wild Details
sub_head: George Stubbs’s ‘Zebra’ is anatomically correct, beautiful and mysterious—a portrait of a true individual.
body: In his 1902 “Just So Stories,” Rud-yard Kipling said the zebra got its stripes by standing half in the shade and half out, “with the slippery-slidy shadows of the trees” falling on its body.
